quotes.quote: Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.
Never abandon a theory that explains something until you have a theory that explains more.
Theory without data is myth: data without theory is madness.
Theories are private property, but truth is common stock
We must alter theory to adapt it to nature, but not nature to adapt it to theory.
Experience by itself teaches nothing...Without theory, experience has no meaning. Without theory, one has no questions to ask. Hence without theory there is no learning.
In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is.
A good scientific theory is one which is falsifiable, which has not been falsified.

Theory is worth but little, unless it can explain its own phenomena, and it must effect this without contradicting itself; therefore, the facts are sometimes assimilated to the theory, rather than the theory to the facts.
It is the theory which decides what can be observed.
The truth of a theory is in your mind, not in your eyes.

quotes.cite: Jan L. A. van de Snepscheut
quotes.quote: The difference between theory and practice is larger in practice than the difference between theory and practice in theory.
Leave your theories. All theories, you see, even those of virtue, are bad, foolish, mischievous.
The moment a person forms a theory, his imagination sees in every object only the traits which favor that theory.
Theories are usually the over-hasty efforts of an impatient understanding that would gladly be rid of phenomena, and so puts in their place pictures, notions, nay, often mere words.
A theory is no more like a fact than a photograph is like a person.
Generally the theories we believe we call facts, and the facts we disbelieve we call theories.
A theory must be tempered with reality.
All theories are legitimate, no matter. What matters is what you do with them.
All theory, dear friend, is gray, but the golden tree of life springs ever green.
Theory and practice sometimes clash. And when that happens, theory loses. Every single time.
A young man is a theory, an old man is a fact.
Every theory is a self-fulfilling prophecy that orders experience into the framework it provides.
Theories are neither hunches nor guesses. They are the crown jewels of science.
Those who say theory and practice are two unrelated realms are fools in one and scoundrels in the other.
The theory of rights enables us to rise and overthrow obstacles, but not to found a strong and lasting accord between all the elements which compose the nation.
Theory helps us to bear our ignorance of fact.
There is a distinction, but no opposition, between theory and practice. Each to a certain extent supposes the other. Theory is dependent on practice; practice must have preceded theory.
An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
No theory is good unless it permits, not rest, but the greatest work. No theory is good except on condition that one use it to go on beyond.
